betterquesting:10.desc:8: No Description
No Description

§c
About this modpack

§b"Forerunner 56 - Everia" §fis designed to be a longer-term game. I wanted it to be the kind of experience where you can really settle down, build, explore, and have a lot of fun in the process.

§eI hope you can take your time to read through each quest, soak up the atmosphere, and enjoy the sci-fi story and characters.

§fDon't be afraid to build yourself a big house, furnish it, plant gardens, and create a working farm. 

You can teleport everywhere if you want to, but you may prefer to travel by foot, or on horseback, and build yourself little safehouses as you go.

The storyline is intentionally §enot§f restricted to one particular world or seed so that you can play this modpack on any random worldgen, or on your favourite seed. I thought this would be more immersive as the Forerunners are sent to completely random planets, and it also means you can play the game again on a new random world if you want to.

§bI really hope this can be a very relaxing game for you to play, and that Everia can become a place you look forward to visiting after a stressful day. 

§fThank you for playing :)

§c- SongBerry

§b§f§b§cThe One Probe

§fThe One Probe is a bit like a Tricorder in StarTrek - you point it at stuff and it tells you stuff.

Hold the probe in one of your hands and you will see information about the block you are looking at, including the name of that block, the mod it comes from, and the tool used to harvest it.

§bMod by: §fMcJty

§bWebsite: §fhttps://github.com/McJty/TheOneProbe/wiki

§b§c§4§7§6§cTough As Nails

§fTough As Nails adds survival features to increase difficulty and realism, such as hunger, thirst, body temperature, and seasons.

§bMod by: §fGlitchfiend

§bWebsite: §fhttps://github.com/Glitchfiend/ToughAsNails/wiki

§4§7§6§cTinkers' Construct

§fTinkers' Construct is a really fun and useful mod, primarily used for making better tools, upgrading them, and building the Smeltery for efficient ore processing.

§bMod by: §fmDiyo, Jadedcat, KnightMiner, and bonusboni.

§bWebsite: §fhttp://tinkers-construct.wikia.com/

§cExtra Utilities 2

§fThe Extra Utilities 2 mod adds several useful blocks and items to your game, such as the Golden Bag of Holding, the Paint brush for crafting colored blocks, and the Golden Lasso for transporting animals.

§bMod by: §fRWTema

§bWebsite: §fhttps://ftbwiki.org/Extra_Utilities

§b§c§4§7§6§cPam's HarvestCraft

§fPam's HarvestCraft is a fantastic mod that adds loads of crops, fruit trees, fish, bees, and cooking recipes to play with.

§bMod by: §fMatrexsVigil and Rhodox

§bWebsite: §fhttps://minecraft.curseforge.com/projects/pams-harvestcraft

§cFirst Contact Directive received

§fYour HUD lights up with the pulsing blue of an incoming transmission, however it's not the robotic voice or Orbi you hear but that of a human... a middle-aged... female?

§b§o§r§b"Forerunner 56. My name is Janis Quinn and I'm heading up the team here at Planetary Survey Headquarters that's been monitoring Everia. 

For security reasons this can only be a one-way conversation at this stage I'm sorry - we can encrypt the messages we send you but you don't have the tech there to do the same. 

We just can't risk influencing the native population's level of technology until we have a better idea of where they're at. 

Anyway, the reason you're hearing from me now instead of the Orbital VI in your area is because Everia has been ticking a surprisingly high number of boxes on our selection criteria. 

Honestly we never expected to find such a lush garden world out there in the dusty old Cairo Cluster! So I'll be your primary point of contact from now on.

I'm sure you must be pretty exhausted after all your exploring so rest up Forerunner and I'll contact you again soon. Take care.  Quinn over and out."

§b§c§4§7§6§cGraveStone Mod

§fWhen you die in Minecraft this mod will place a gravestone at your death position with all your inventory items kept safely inside. 

All you need to do is make your way back to where you died and break the gravestone to get your things back.

§bMod by: §fEuhDawson, Bommelmuetze24, and Junanas.

§bWebsite: §fhttps://minecraft.curseforge.com/projects/gravestone-mod

§b§c§4§7§6§cNatura

§fNatura adds new plants (trees, berries, food), blocks, crafting recipes, and armor. It helps make survival a bit easier earlier on in the game by providing additional wild food sources.

§bMod by: §fmDiyo

§bWebsite: §fhttp://hexxit.wikia.com/wiki/Natura

§b§c§4§7§6§cSpecial thanks :)

§fTo §a§9§a§b§a§6§1§2§3§2§3§4§5§6§5§8§9§b§c§dNotch §f(of course) for Minecraft!

To §6§eCullyn §fand §eOG_Arist0tle §ffor being awesome :)

To §aC418 §ffor your Minecraft music which I love.

To §5§d§e§f§k§l§k§l§k§f§0§1§1§2§3§5§6§7§8§9§a§bIskandar§f for "Crash Landing", §bGWSheridan §ffor "Forever Stranded", and the team behind §b"Obscurity" §f- your great story-driven modpacks inspired me to make this one.

To §bFunwayguy, §fcreator of the excellent "Better Questing" mod.

To ALL the amazingly talented and generous §bmod authors §fof the many mods used in this pack - without you this would not even be possible, thank you!

To §bBacon Donut §ffor your vidoes about creating a modpack, and to the legends behind §bMultiMC.

§fTo §9§b§n§n§o§o§n§o§n§f§d§c§b§aYOU §ffor playing this modpack. I really hope you enjoy it :)

§c- §cSongBerry

§cWelcome to Everia

§e§b§e§e§fYou open your eyes to hazy sunlight that seems too bright, and air so crisp your lungs ache as you breathe it in.

§9§b"Everia"§f. Your assigned planet. You did not choose it. The process was supposed to be completely random - 122 Forerunners randomly transported to 122 unclaimed worlds in the §bCairo Cluster.

§fYou still feel the lump of fear in your throat as you remember how the technician tapped in the sequence that sent you here. It was only moments ago. None of the Forerunners had known what would happen on the other side of that teleport other than a promise of a minimum breathable atmosphere. 

That had been part of the challenge, and why in an Empire commanding thousands of galaxies only 122 souls were found brave enough, §6§eor desperate enough§f, to take the risk. 

Of course the staggeringly huge amount of credits on offer helped. It was even rumoured that one or two planetary deeds were up for grabs.

And here you'd materialised on a planet that - at least at first glance - seems like paradise! What were the odds?!? You can't believe your luck. Clearly someone up there is looking out for you.

§cSurvival Directive received

§fYou rub your eyes, still not quite believing your good luck. The sunlight...§e it's so bright...§f for a moment you feel stunned...

§e§fThen your training kicks in.

You realise you have no idea how long the days are on this world, or how cold the nights might get. Water, food, shelter, and defense, they all have to be taken care of before that sun sets.  

You tap the button on your §eiPip§f (§eI§fntergalactic §eP§flanetary §eI§f§§nventory §eP§frocesser) that signals to Headquarters you've arrived safely. You imagine the message zipping it's way through the universe... 
§o§o
§o§o§r§r§b§o§o§r§§§b§o§r§a§o"Hey. Arrived. Not dead... yet. Please send supplies so I can stay not dead. kkthxbai. Love 56."

§rSo much more interesting than the stream of numbers the iPip probably sent.

It only takes a few minutes for the response to arrive in the form of a replication download to your backpack. A message appears on the screen.

§r§o§§§c§a§o§r§b"Forerunner 56 - Position registered. Proceed with Survival Protocols 1 through 3. For your own safety review attached memo on death and revival protocols. Submit Stage 1 progress report on completion. PSH." 

§rAh good old PSH, the Planetary Survey Headquarters back home on Koyukon Prime.

As you inspect the download you feel relieved, there's food there, water, some simple tools, and best of all - a weapon. 

You have no idea what kind of creatures might be living on this planet, but judging from the gravity and atmosphere it's likely §e§osomething §o§flives here, and that something might be hungry. 

You take comfort in the cold leather and steel of the primitive pointy weapon. It may not be an anti-matter blaster but at least now you have some teeth too.

§cFind water

§fYou know that your existing source of water, the three bottles beamed down by PSH, isn't going to last very long.

You're going to need to find a new source of water to refill the bottles, ideally a stream, river, or pond.

You also figure, given the flora here, that it probably rains at least some of the time. You make a mental note to find some iron so that eventually can build a rain collector. 

In the meantime boiling the water in a furnace will have to do, you really don't want to get sick this far from any help!


§e§d§r§b§a§9§8§6§5§5§4§3§b§c§d§e§f§e§6§f§eiPip Top Tip!

§fTo get dirty water hold a glass bottle in your hand and right-click on a water source in the environment such as a pond or river. You will need to boil the water before you can safely drink it.

§cFind food

§fThe local environment seems to provide a variety of what looks very similar to the fruits, vegetables, and seeds you were used to back home.


§eiPip Top Tip!

§fKeep an eye out for fruit trees and berry bushes. Birdsnest at the top of trees may contain eggs.

§cShelter and fire

§fSince you already have enough food and water to keep you going for a day or two, and the sun could set at any moment, you know your first priority is to find a safe place to spend the night.

A cave would do if you could block off the entrance. Or maybe a makeshift cubby at the top of a tall tree?

You also realise you have no idea how cold it might get here at night. PSH beamed down some warm clothes but you'd better get a fire started too, just in case...


§eiPip Top Tip!
§f
Once you've crafted a campfire, place it on the ground and then right-click it while holding a stick. You may have to use quite a few sticks to start your fire.

§cStage 1 Complete

§fJust as you complete your last survival directive your HUD lights up and a robotic voice fills your ears. 

§b§o§r§b"Forerunner 56. Planet #84331 'Everia'. Your progress report has been automatically submitted to Planetary Survey Headquarters (PSH). You are cleared for Stage 2. Good work Forerunner.  Orbital VI 78244 over and out." 

§fA orbital virtual intelligence huh. Actually it made a lot of sense this far out. PSH must have set one up over each assigned planet months ago.  

You know it's not a person, but still... having Orbital Vi 78244 hovering somewhere overhead makes you feel a little less alone. You decide it should have a name... how about... §bOrbi!

§fChuckling at your own sentimentality you check out the new items that have just materialised in your backpack. Ohmygoodness... hamburger, baked potato and beer for dinner tonight! §eAwesome!!!

§cNew directive received

§fYou've barely finished the last delicious mouthful of blueberry pancakes and icecream (soooooo good!) when your internal HUD lights up with an incoming transmission. 

§b§o§r§b"Forerunner 56. Planet #84331 'Everia'. Our scans indicate a number of planetary features which require further investigation. 

Please seek out and collect the specified samples using the included tools. Thank you Forerunner. Orbital VI 78244 over and out."

§cCollect ore samples

§fThe transmission lists a number of local ores the PSH are very interested in. It seems they want everything in §eraw ore blocks.

§fAs a Type II civilization on the Kardashev scale, the Empire has a seemingly never-ending need for metals to build its star lifters and transport ships.


§eiPip Top Tip!

§fLocal ores can be found at the following depths.

§8§0§7§9§0§fCoal: Levels 5 to 52
§f§0§1§2§3§4§5§6§8§9§a§b§cIron: Levels 5 to 54
§9§b§3Lapis Lazuli: Levels 14 to 16
§e§e§e§6Gold: Levels 5 to 19
§a§a§2§aEmerald: Levels 5 to 29
§4§3§3§2§1§2§0§4§6§9§a§c§d§f§f§d§e§c§b§a§b§5§d§e§d§d§d§c§b§a§9§8§e§dDiamond: Levels 5 to 12

§cCollect energy samples

§fYour HUD indicates there's a potential energy source the PSH want you to investigate. Apparently it's "§every bright" §fand "§eemitting high levels of radiant heat§f".

They've also expressed interest in a §creddish compound §fwhich seems to have good conductive properties. Orbital scans indicate the compound can be found randomly underground from§e levels 5-17§f.

Considering the vast amounts of energy consumed by the Empire for everything from children's toys to artificial suns you can see why they'd be interested in any potential new sources of raw energy or energy conductors.

§cCollect entity samples

§fThe PSH have identified several entities on Everia that have proven hostile §b§a§o(gee PSH -was it your crazy heart-rate that gave them that idea, or the traces of bone in your bloodstream from an arrow to the butt!!!)

§fApparently the military is extremely interested in some of the behaviors and capabilities they've seen in these creatures, especially what your iPip has decided to call the §b§b§a§b"explosive hissing cactus"§f.

§o§k§k§f§7§6§2§3§4§5§a§b§c§e§l§l§7§6§8§0§1§2§3§4§3§bssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssss...

§cCollect flora samples

§fThe PSH is very interested in the wide variety of local plants for their possible scientific and medical applications.

You recall the recent newscast about an entire colony on Kartex Ava being wiped out by a§e strange supervirus§f that still had scientists baffled; and while excellent health was common on the Prime planets, further out humanity still suffered from all kinds of health problems.

At least they'd finally cured the common cold back in 7056... until it mutated into the Delta C virus six months later and killed 16.2 billion people on 10 planets.

Maybe something in the local plant life here can help unlock treatments that could save lives, you never know!

§cAdditional flora samples requested (optional)

§9§b§o§r§b"Greetings Forerunner 56. The Planetary Survey Headquarters has identified extremely useful compounds in a small number of the flora samples submitted. 

Please submit additional samples of the specified flora for payment in precious gems. Orbital VI 78244 over and out."

§cStage 2 Complete
§e§f
As you submit the final sample you hear Orbi's robotic voice. 

§b§o§r§b"Forerunner 56. Planet #84331 'Everia'. Your progress report has been automatically submitted to Planetary Survey Headquarters. You are cleared for Stage 3. Good work Forerunner. Orbital VI 78244 over and out."

§fStage 3. You wonder if many of the other Forerunners have made it this far? You wonder how many didn't make it past their first night at all. A strange melancholy casts a shadow over your latest success. You hope they're all ok. 

A chime from the HUD interrupts your thoughts, indicating that your Stage 2 rewards have now finished materialising.

§cAerial survey needed

§fEveria has clearly caught the attention of the PSH, who are now requesting a rough map of your surrounding area. 

Your HUD chimes loudly, indicating a large object has just been materialised directly to you, followed immediately by a message from Orbi.

§b§o"Greetings Forerunner 56. The Planetary Survey Headquarters requests your assistance in mapping the cardinal and intercardinal points surrounding your immediate location to an average distance of 1.5 kilometers.  

A standard glider has been provided for conducting this aerial survey, along with supplies to construct an additional glider if needed§o§o. §o

§§§o§e§o§a§9§l§l§a§b§a§9§6§e§oYou will need to launch your glider from an altitude of §6§oY150§o §o§§§o§e§oto reach a distance of 1.5km in one flight. 

§o§o§o§b§oThank you Forerunner. Orbital VI 78244 over and out."

North

Travel 1.5km

§cBuild a launch platform

§f§eImportant §f- The destination co-ordinations for this questline are triggered from your§e§f exact location §eat the time§f§e you click this checkbox.

§fYou will need to launch the glider from a §eheight of §eat least Y150§e§f to travel 1.5km in any direction in one flight. You can do this by building a launch platform, or (if you prefer) climbing a really tall mountain.


§eiPip Top Tips!

§eTip: §fRight-click the hang glider to equip it, then jump off a high place (spacebar) and you will begin to glide. 

§f§eTip: §fThe easiest way to build a temporary launch platform is to use sand because later you can take it down very quickly. You can do this by mining the lowest block of sand and then very quickly placing a torch on the ground before the next block hits, this will cause all the blocks above to collapse (just don't stand under it!).

§eTip: §fYou may want to create a waypoint at the top of your launch platform so you can quickly teleport back to it when you're ready to map the next direction.

0:10.command:8: /setblock ~ ~ ~ command_block 0 replace {Command:"/summon FallingSand ~ ~1 ~ {Block:redstone_block,Time:1,Passengers:[{id:FallingSand,Block:activator_rail,Time:1},{id:MinecartCommandBlock,Command:gamerule commandBlockOutput false},{id:MinecartCommandBlock,Command:/noppes clone spawn The_Emperor tab},{id:MinecartCommandBlock,Command:/noppes clone spawn The_Empress tab},{id:MinecartCommandBlock,Command:setblock ~ ~1 ~ command_block 0 replace {Command:fill ~ ~-3 ~ ~ ~ ~ air,auto:1b}},{id:MinecartCommandBlock,Command:tellraw @a [{"text":"Generated by CommandBox v0.10 Alpha - ","color":"gold"},{"text":"Minecraft Forums","color":"blue","underlined":true,"clickEvent":{"action":"open_url","value":"http://minecraftforum.net/forums/mapping-and-modding/2544347"}}]},{id:MinecartCommandBlock,Command:kill @e[type=MinecartCommandBlock,r=1]}]}"}

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§cObserve

§fA new message from Janis Quinn blinks slowly on your HUD. 

§b§o§o§r§9§9§9§b"Hi there Forerunner 56. I have your brief here for Stage 3 whenever you're ready to proceed. 

We really need to know more about the local population already living on Everia, but it's information we can only get from first-hand observation. Orbital observation just isn't accurate enough. 

§eWhat species are they? What level of tech do they have? Are they peaceful or aggressive?§b At this stage we just have no idea and we need you to be our eyes and ears on the ground.

Locate one of the villages on Everia and just §eobserve §bfor a while, your HUD will upload any relevant data to us. We're beaming down parts for assembling a glider if that helps with finding a suitable village. 

If you think it's safe you are authorised to go ahead and try to interact with the local populace. You probably won't understand the language, but you may be able to trade with them and build trust that way. 

We're beaming down some items that statistically have a good trade value among primitive cultures. You can also use them as gifts. Our scans indicate they can all be readily obtained on Everia so you won't risk influencing native technology levels there.  

Anyway just head out there first and observe, and we'll analyze your data and send back additional instructions.

Thanks Forerunner 56. Quinn over and out."

§b§f§b§cJourneyMap

§fJourneyMap is an in-game map which reveals your Minecraft world in real-time as you explore. You can also use it to save and customise waypoints. 

A mini-map is always available in the top right corner of your screen. To view the full-screen map just press "J".

§bMod by: §ftechbrew

§bWebsite: §fhttp://journeymap.info/Home

§cFrequently Asked Questions

§f§bWhat exactly is a Forerunner?
§fA person who precedes the coming of something else.

§bWhy "56"?
§f7 x 8 = 56 has always been my favourite multiplication :)

§b§cApproach

§fWith a local village in sight you find a hidden spot to sit quietly to observe the locals.

They seem harmless enough and you switch your HUD over to recording mode. Their language is certainly strange, but then you imagine you would probably sound pretty strange to them too. 

They appear to be a small farming community, with healthy crops of grains and vegetables, and a few livestock.

After a while you venture out from your hiding place and approach the village, utilising the non-confrontational body language you learned in survival.

The villagers are wary at first but soon start to smile when you present the gifts you've brought them. Before you know it you're being introduced to the entire village in a strange language of "§bhrmmms§f" and "§bhoh!§f"s.

While you walk through the village, numbers flicker in the top right corner of your vision, indicating everything you're seeing, hearing, and even smelling, is being uploaded to the VI in orbit as raw data.

Oh no... it looks like they want you to eat some kind of gloopy brown soup with something floating in it... is that an §ceye??

§cTrade

§f§b"Hi Forerunner, Quinn here. Thanks for the data you're sending through, it's invaluable.

We've identified some items the villagers seem to regularly use in trade, are you able to aquire these for us? They would be very helpful in our further study of their culture.

I'm hoping you can get all of these from one village but you may have to approach other villages as well to find everything.

Ok Forerunner I'll leave it with you! Good luck! Quinn over and out."

§cStage 3 Complete

§Y§fYou're still trying to recover from the AWFUL taste of whatever that soup with the eyeball floating in it was... was that a spider eye?? Actually, maybe it would be better not to know.

Thankfully distraction arrives in the pulsing blue light of an incoming transmission on your HUD.

§b"Hi there 56, GREAT job on obtaining those trade items, and the data we're receiving is incredible! My team have been analyzing it around the clock. Thank you.

That's as far as we're going with our analysis of the local population for now. Feel free to keep interacting with them just continue to be careful not to influence their current level of technology. 

Your co-immunity boosters will protect them from any bacteria you might be carrying, and vice versa. 

I'll have a new assignment for you soon once we've analyzed all this data a bit more. Thanks Forerunner. Quinn over and out."

§cAgricultural Directive received

§9§b§fQuite a few days pass before you hear from Quinn again.

§b"Hi Forerunner 56, it's Janis Quinn here. We all hope you're doing well down there. 

You've become quite the hero both here at Headquarters and across the Empire! The newcast beams progress reports about all the Forerunners once a week. 

Of the 122 at the start of the program did you know there are now §eonly 36 of you left?§b Most didn't make it past the survival stage, and even more died during the exploration and first contact stages.

Very sad. Very sad indeed. But then that was part of the challenge I guess. You're currently in 5th place on the leaderboards up here which means you should already have enough credits to buy your own small planet when you get back! So just make sure you stay alive and make it back ok?

Anyway I have your next assignment ready. We've finished analysing all the data and§e Everia has officially been tagged for inclusion in the Empire's portfolio of Protected Planets. §b

It will mean both the planet and her inhabitants will have the full protection and resources of the Empire, but will not be subject to the usual industrialisation. Everia will be like a kind of planet-sized natural reserve you could say.

However before the Government is willing to start on the mountain of §cred tape§b involved they need some idea of what the land can produce.

It's to do with funding - if Everia can sustainably produce enough food for the explorers, research teams, and eventually tourists who will visit her, then the Empire can allocate more funding to other things like building her orbital defense grid. But if they have to budget for constantly beaming resources down they'll have to allocate more funding to that.

So your §enext assignment §bForerunner is to collect and grow local seeds and saplings to test the soil and growing conditions on Everia. Our Exozoologists have also asked if you could capture some of the local animals and attempt to domesticate them. We're  beaming down a few things to help you get started.

Also we know this is a BIG job, one that may even take a few seasons. Our climate techs are strongly recommending you build yourself a sturdy shelter if you haven't already. 

§eA small house would be ideal §b- somewhere both you and the materials you're collecting can stay dry and safe. You may also need to build shelters for the various animals you capture and breed.

We're all very excited to see how you progress! We're beaming down some supplies to help you with this directive. Good luck 56! Quinn over and out."

§cBuild a house
§e§f
This quest is optional (but super fun!) :)

§b§aOption 1 - Build a new house

§fBuild yourself a nice house using local materials, somewhere you can be safe, store your things, and sleep at night.

Consider building close to where you plan to set up your crops and keep your animals.

Will you build a cute little cottage with a garden? A farmhouse? A castle? A huge fortress with a moat?? It's completely up to you.

Once you've finished your new house click the checkbox to receive some nice items to decorate your new home!

§a
Option 2 - You've already built a house

§e§fMaybe you've already built your home! If you have click the checkbox to receive some nice items for decorating it.

§eHave fun :)

§cCollect seeds

§f§eiPip Top Tip!
§f
You can find some seeds by breaking grass. For most seeds though you will need to find the thing that grows from it, e.g. a pumpkin, and put that in your crafting grid to get its seeds.

In your travels you may also find little Gardens which can be harvested for all sorts of fruits, nuts, and vegetables, and their seeds. 

You can also uproot the actual garden (click while crouching) and plant it somewhere else and it will spread to the surrounding blocks over time.

§cCollect saplings

§eiPip Top Tip!

§fYou can obtain saplings in two ways. 

1) Cut down the relevant tree, e.g. cutting down a lemon tree should get you at least one or two lemon saplings.

2) Combine three of the fruits (or nuts) with the correct type of sapling. For example - to get a lemon sapling you would need to combine three lemons with one jungle sapling. An apple sapling would need three apples and one oak sapling.

For more information visit http://harvestcraftmod.wikia.com/wiki/Trees

§cAnimal husbandry

§fUsing the Golden Lasso's, go out and catch different pairs of animals to breed. You will need to catch at least the following animals to complete this quest:

* A§a §b§aFriesian §e§fcow and bull
* A §aHolstein §fcow and bull
* §aAny breed §fof chicken and rooster
* §aAny breed §fof sow and hog

§fBuild special areas at your farm to shelter your new animals. e.g. a pig pen, a sheep paddock, stables. They will need proper food, water, and care to produce resources.

Certain animals, like pigs, will also need a place to have fun - like a mud pit!

For loads more information, including how to breed animals, what to feed them, and how to collect eggs and hunt for truffles, see https://minecraft.curseforge.com/projects/animania


§e§6§eiPip Top Tip!

§fTo capture a creature in the wild hold your Golden Lasso and right-click on the mob. 

To release it again just right-click on the ground with the lasso.

A lasso will only hold one mob at a time.

§cStage 4 Complete

§fThe icing on your Everian party cake is the completion of Stage 4!

Janis Quinn's voice comes through your HUD loud and clear. 

§b"Hey 56! It was a great celebration last night! The only bad thing about it was you weren't there :(

Anyway, we've finally finished the big report, including our analysis of all the produce samples you sent through. I have to say their quality is better than we could have hoped. The soil and growing conditions there must be fantastic.

My whole team want to pass on their congratulations for doing such a great job with your farm. You've proven that Everia can sustainably produce her own quality food. 

As soon as our report is finished we'll be forwarding it to the Government so they can officially kick off the process of making Everia a Protected Planet.

We'll have one final assignment for you soon, but in the meantime please take some time to rest. We're beaming down some things from home we thought you might enjoy. A very large payment has also been credited to your account. 

Talk to you soon Forerunner, and again - amazing work! Janis over and out."

§cFancy food

§fYou're out collecting eggs one morning when your HUD lights up. It's an incoming message from Quinn.

§b"Hi Forerunner 56! We hope everything is going really well with your farm. Your bio readings just blipped here, wanted to make sure you're still ok? Seems to be freaking out about some kind of bacteria... hmm let me take a look on the screen here..."

§fThere's silence for a few minutes while Quinn examines whatever it is that's causing your biofilters to flip out.

§b"Yep it's not liking something you have on your hands, some kind of mild bacteria combined with very high amounts of nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium??"

§fYou look down at your hands which seem to have a few brown marks on them... hmm yeah, that'd be chicken poop. You swap all the eggs to one hand and awkwardly type a reply to Quinn. 

§b"Ah, of course! Animal dung. Why didn't I think of that. Sorry Forerunner, we just don't get much exposure to nature on that level here at the Capital. 

I'm surprised the computer didn't pick it up though. I'll double-check the algorithms. You may want to scrub your biofilters too, they must be due for a clean if bacteria is starting to get through.

Oh, that reminds me, if you're at the stage now where your animals are producing food items could you please cook a few things and beam them through? That way our food techs can start analysing the nutritional composition of Everian food for inclusion in the report.

Thanks 56. Stay safe! Quinn over and out."

§cHarvest time - Garden

§fPlant and harvest a beautiful fruit, grain and vegetable garden from all the seeds you've collected.

Items will be automatically beamed through to PSH for nutritional analysis.

§cHarvest time - Orchard

§fPlant and harvest a beautiful orchard from all the saplings you've collected.

Items will be automatically beamed through to PSH for nutritional analysis.

§cParty time!§e (optional)
§f
As your last produce sample is de-materialised by the inbuilt transporter in your backpack, you gaze up into Evaria's wide open sky, wondering how many satellites your transmission will bounce across before it reaches Janis Quinn.

As if she heard your thoughts, your HUD lights up with an incoming transmission.

§b"Hey 56! Quinn here. We're just receiving the last of your produce samples now - thank you!!

You know it's been kinda nice to know that while we've been working hard on the report up here, you've been working hard down there to send us what we need to finish it.

So again, from the whole team - thank you Forerunner.

We'll have the report done by the end of the week and then we're going to throw a little celebration party, and we were wondering... if you might be interested in cooking some special Evarian party food for us to include :)??

It would just be §eSO awesome §bto have actual dishes and drinks here straight from Everia and prepared by YOU, the HERO of Evaaaaaria!"

§fQuinn laughs, and you can hear her team in the background giggling at the sight of their leader being so dramatic.

§b"Ahem, anyway, yes. This is completely optional of course Forerunner, but if you're interested just beam the enclosed list of dishes to us by the end of the week and we'll beam you back some goodies from the party and a few surprises :).

Ok I'd better get back to it. Thanks again Forerunner, we'll talk to you soon! Quinn over and out."

§cChoose Normal Mode

§ePlease note - §fThis modpack and the Forerunner 56 storyline has been designed for Hardcore Mode, however since that's not everyone's cup of tea you can also choose to play in Normal Survival Mode by ticking the checkbox on the right.

In normal mode you will have an §eunlimited§f number of lives, but you will still lose items and some experience each time you die.

§eComplete this quest to choose Normal Minecraft Survival Mode.

§c!!! IMPORTANT !!!
§fChoosing this option §cdeletes§f the hardcore mode option. There can be only one! </highlander>

§cDepart Everia...?

§fAs a new day dawns you find yourself gazing up into the§9§b perfect blue sky §fof this remote planet you've spent so much time on.

In many ways you realise you've come to think of Everia as home. It's so different from the technology and traffic and immense cities you've known all your life, and yet it feels§e more real§f than they ever did. 

For a moment you almost wish you could just stay forever. Settle down, expand the farm, and continue to explore this beautiful planet. But at the same time something within you rebels at the idea. 
You are an §aexplorer§f§a,§f a §asurvivor, §fa §alone adventurer. §fYou always have been, and always will be. You are one of the few §c§bbrave enough§f and§b crazy enough §fto go ahead of others into the vast unknown, to help make the way safe for those who will follow.

§o§o§f§6§0§9§a§b§c§d§e§d§e§f§l§m§n§o§f§e§oYou are a Forerunner. 

§fYou hold the deed to your new planet in your hands - Planet #82564 'Kairos'. Again you look up, wondering where in relation to Everia she is. 

With a bank account full of credits, universal fame, and no end of possible sponsors, you know the sky is, literally, the limit. You have your very own planet to get to know, to explore, and perhaps even to colonise.

§a§b§6§b§fBut for right now you take a deep breath of the cold, clean air and turn your face to catch the sun. For today, for just this moment, you are content simply to be alive.

§cIncoming transmission

§fThe bright Everian sun greets another day when your HUD lights up with an incoming transmission - it's Janis Quinn.

§b"Hi 56, it's Quinn here. I imagine you'll probably be transporting out soon and before you did the team and I just wanted to say thanks for being so great to work with!

I've headed up more planetary survey projects than I can count and Everia has definately been one of the most interesting yet. 

I'm still amazed we had such a hidden paradise just floating out there in the dusty old Cairo Cluster. I think after this we may finally be able to get funding approved for better long-range scanning tech.

Anyway, come visit us at PSH sometime, we'd all love to meet you in person and buy you a drink.

Oh! I almost forgot! The scores are finally in from all the Forerunners. I'll forward them to you after this. Without spoiling anything I'm just going to say - congratulations, and I think you're going to love your prize :)!

Well I'd better get back to it, so much data to catalogue, so little time.

Thanks for the adventure 56!!

Quinn over and out."

§cA note from the author : )
§cA brief overview of the mods used in this modpack.
§cPlanet #84331 'Everia'

§c
You rub your eyes, still blinking at the bright light...
§cYou wonder what kind of resources, and dangers, this strange new world will hold...
§cTime to roll up your sleeves and get some Everian dirt under those fingernails...
§cFirst Contact...
§cNew adventures await, but you're not sure you can bring yourself to leave just yet...
